meanings.definition: To rule over or control someone in a harsh or arrogant way.
meanings.sent1: The boss domineered his employees, making all the decisions without considering their opinions.
meanings.sent2: She always domineered her younger siblings, telling them what to do and how to do it.
meanings.sent3: The cat domineered the dog, making sure it always got the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The dictator domineered the country, suppressing any form of dissent.
meanings.sent5: The bully domineered the playground, intimidating the other kids into doing what he wanted.

meanings.definition: To assert one's will over others in an overbearing manner.
meanings.sent1: He constantly domineered his friends, always insisting on his way for every decision.
meanings.sent2: The coach domineered the team, pushing them to their limits in every practice.
meanings.sent3: The toddler domineered the playgroup, demanding all the toys for himself.
meanings.sent4: The wealthy businessman domineered the negotiations, ensuring he got the best deal possible.
meanings.sent5: The queen domineered the court, making sure her commands were always followed without question.
